turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Cheyenne, Wyoming.
turn.1: What was the organization of the first government of Wyoming called?
turn.2: The Wyoming Stock Growers Association met at The Cheyenne Club, which allegedly acted as an interim government for the territory.
turn.3: What is the important fact about this period in time that you can tell me about it?
turn.4: Many of the WSGA's rules and regulations became state laws.
turn.5: Did Cheyenne have any other government roles?
turn.6: The Cheyenne Regional Airport was opened in 1920, initially serving as a stop for airmail.
turn.7: What kind of expansion did the airport do?
turn.8: It soon developed into a civil-military airport, serving DC-3s and various military craft.
turn.9: Did you know what happened in 1941?
turn.10: During World War II, hundreds of B-17s, B-24s, and PBYs were outfitted and upgraded at the airfield.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Today, it serves a number of military functions, as well as a high-altitude testbed for civilian craft. Lying near the southeast corner of the state, Cheyenne is one of the least centrally located state capitals in the nation (together with cities such as Carson City, Nevada; Juneau, Alaska; and Topeka, Kansas).
